title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 July 2016 - XWiki
content:
<mflorea> has quit  
01:14 <abusenius> has quit  
04:36 <lkrejci> has quit  
04:36 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
05:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:06 <lkrejci> has quit  
06:06 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
06:58 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:21 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

08:31 <tmortagne> has quit

09:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <abusenius> has quit  
10:18 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <mflorea> vmassol: what's the status for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8243 can you close it?  
10:35 <vmassol> I reverted it  
10:35 <vmassol> changing the fix version  
10:35 <mflorea> ok, thanks  
10:35 <vmassol> done  
10:35 <lkrejci> has quit  
10:35 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <vmassol> hmm wait  
10:36 <vmassol> the commiit tab shows a different story  
10:36 <vmassol> analysing  
10:36 <vmassol> ah yes  
10:36 <vmassol> I know  
10:36 <vmassol> I had prepared it for after the RC1 and it got pushed with some other javadoc fix I did :(  
10:37 <vmassol> reverting again  
10:37 <vmassol> it's a pain, next time we really need a branch created  
10:37 <vmassol> when we're lagging so much  
10:38 <mflorea> yes  
10:38 <mflorea> sorry about that  
10:38 <vmassol> seems I also pushed other stuff that I had  
10:38 <vmassol> will also revert them  
10:39 <vmassol> do you know how to get back my changes after I revert?  
10:40 <mflorea> you revert the revert commit I guess  
10:40 <vmassol> yes that's one good option I guess :)  
10:40 <vmassol> need to remember it  
10:41 <vmassol> need to remeber to do it I mean  
10:41 <vmassol> I can do it just now I guess  
10:41 <vmassol> and not push  
10:41 <vmassol> no, I'll just mention it in the jira issue  
10:41 <vmassol> safer  
10:44 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> @mflorea: should be ok now (reverted changes)  
10:48 <mflorea> ok, thanks. I'm wrapping up for the release  
11:07 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:35 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <msmeria> has quit  
11:43 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki

13:35 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <M-vmassol> has quit  
14:56 <M-mouhb> has quit  
14:56 <Chris[m]> has quit  
14:56 <M-jsimard> has quit  
14:56 <blabla2[m]> has quit  
14:56 <M-cjd> has quit  
14:57 <M-yflory> has quit  
15:07 <mflorea> tmortagne: is XWIKI-13561 important for 8.2RC1? I was waiting for the ci to finish the build in order to start the release  
15:07 <tmortagne> mflorea: it not very important but it's not dangerous  
15:08 <mflorea> ok  
15:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> So, apparently XWiki is missing mass actions on livetable items. I was told I could script it, but have no idea where to even begin with this. Any pointers? I have a MediaWiki import gone 100% wrong that put stuff all over the main wiki space, mixed in with the XWiki internals.  
15:18 <msmeria> has quit  
15:26 <Chris[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:34 <fcharton> has quit  
16:02 <M-cjd> has joined #xwiki  
16:02 <M-jsimard> has joined #xwiki  
16:03 <M-yflory> has joined #xwiki  
16:03 <M-mouhb> has joined #xwiki  
16:03 <blabla2[m]> has joined #xwiki  
16:03 <M-vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:24 <mflorea> tmortagne: I can reproduce http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-observation-test-tests/testReport/org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4/JUnit4Provider/org\_xwiki\_test\_cluster\_AllTests/ locally. Do you have an idea of what might have caused it?  
16:27 <tmortagne> mflorea: currupted hsqldb database maybe, it seems to fail when trying to access the hsqldb database the first time  
16:27 <tmortagne> but no idea what changed for this to happen  
16:30 <tmortagne> (it's the first time I see an error like this so not much experience on the possible causes)  
16:31 <tmortagne> trying to reproduce locally too  
16:31 <mflorea> the test create two instances in target, tying to see which one is bad, if not both  
16:32 <tmortagne> mflorea: there is only one DB in this test  
16:32 <tmortagne> both instances use the same DB  
16:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: you upgraded hsqldb, could it be linked?  
16:32 <mflorea> ah, ok  
16:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: no I did not really upgraded it, we were setting the version in several places  
16:33 <vmassol> ok  
16:35 <tmortagne> mflorea: the actual database is supposed to in ${project.build.directory}/data/database in this test  
16:36 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> I can't find the syntax for org.xwiki.model.reference.EntityReference entries in a form.  
16:36 <mflorea> comparing the hibernate.cfg.xml with one from a working instance, the diff is in the connection URL and some missing resource mappings (activity stream, instance and mailsender)  
16:37 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/MediaWiki/MediaWiki+XML/#HImporteverythinginaspecificwiki2Fspace  
16:37 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Oh, nice.  
16:38 <tmortagne> mflorea: the URL is supposed to be different yes since it's a standalone instance of hsqldb  
16:38 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> tmortagne: Is there a doc somewhere with the syntax for that? wiki: and space:, and what else? And is there a way on a specific page to get it to tell me its ref?  
16:38 <tmortagne> it's an old test so that's probably why it's mossing a few resource mapping but they are not needed by this test anyway  
16:38 <mflorea> indeed, uses hsql protocol  
16:39 <mflorea> vs. file on the other instance where hql is embedded  
16:40 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: the references are documented on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Model+Module#HThevariousReferencestypes and you need to add "wiki:" or "space:" depending on type of the reference you are providing  
16:41 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Awesome. Thanks.  
16:41 <tmortagne> mflorea: I don't see anything wrong in data/database but It's not like I know much about hsqldb format  
16:42 <tmortagne> mflorea: in any case it's definitely a test issue and not a XWiki one, I will take care of this and you can continue the release I think  
16:43 <mflorea> ok, I'll go on with the release then  
16:43 <mflorea> thanks  
16:43 <Pbas> Hello, FYI, on this old extension page http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Chronopolys, the page display lot of "Failed to execute the [velocity] macro. Click on this message for details." message.  
16:43 <Pbas> Error details: "org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: Nested scripts are not allowed. Current Script Macro [velocity] (source [extensions:ExtensionCode.ExtensionSheet]) is executed inside Script Macro [velocity] (source [extensions:ExtensionCode.ExtensionSheet])"  
16:44 <tmortagne> Pbas: extension pages don't allow scripts  
16:44 <tmortagne> but AFAIK they never did so it's weird  
16:45 <tmortagne> maybe it was just copy/pasted there without really looking if it was working or not (this project used to have its own wiki)  
16:45 <Pbas> maybe this extension had particular rights  
16:45 <Pbas> yes probably  
16:45 <tmortagne> it's not really related to rights  
16:45 <tmortagne> it's just because of the way the extension page description is displayed  
16:46 <Pbas> ok  
16:54 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Oh, turns out you can absolutely do mass-updates  
16:54 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> and mass-deletes and such  
16:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> {{documentTree readOnly="false" showWikis="true" showSpaces="true" hierarchyMode="parentchild" links="false" checkboxes="true" showOnlyViewable="false" showRoot="true"/}}  
16:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> and right-click for actions  
17:05 <lkrejci> has quit  
17:05 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
17:05 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: I don't know this feature :) What actions do you get when you right click?  
17:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> new page, go to space, refresh, paste into space, rename..., delete.  
17:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> The delete is iffy?  
17:08 <vmassol> that's nice. I need to try that!  
17:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> it... looks like it works, but the model isn't actual updated.  
17:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> actually\*  
17:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> and it allows things that don't \*actually\* work in the wiki, things like "take these documents, and move them to this other wiki in the farm"  
17:09 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> like, you can drag-and-drop it, and it looks like it could work, but it snaps back.  
17:09 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> in the case of delete, it removes them from the list directly, and that's fine.  
17:09 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> except... after a refresh it's all back.  
17:11 <vmassol> yep I was surprised that it was implemented  
17:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> well the view is. Maybe the controller is partially done tho  
17:18 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:34 <lkrejci> has quit  
17:35 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
17:35 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
17:49 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki

18:07 <moep> has joined #xwiki  
18:28 <vmassol> evalica: question: why have you reoved the NestedSpaces label for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12544  
18:28 <vmassol> ?  
18:29 <evalica> vmassol: by accident - I went over the changes issues to put back, guess I missed this one. Sorry  
18:29 <vmassol> the reason I'm asking is because I thought it nice to be able to see the remaining issue related to NestedSpaces/Pages  
18:29 <vmassol> ah ok  
18:29 <vmassol> np  
18:30 <evalica> hmm.. but on Activity, I don't see I removed it.  
18:30 <evalica> Also is it a NestedSpaces issue?  
18:31 <evalica> vmassol: ?  
18:34 <vmassol> evalica: check the history tab  
18:34 <vmassol> there was "NestedSpaces" before  
18:34 <vmassol> I think it can be considered a NS-related issue  
18:34 <lkrejci> has quit  
18:35 <vmassol> (it's a consequence of it)  
18:35 <evalica> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) changed the Labels to 'usability' on XWIKI-12544 - Allow selection of children in the Export dialog  
18:35 <evalica> Improvement54 minutes ago  
18:35 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
18:35 <evalica> anyway … I'll add it  
18:35 <vmassol> and in any case we've been missing this feature and it's now the opportunity to do it, in the context of NS :)  
18:35 <vmassol> (and it's not hard)  
18:35 <vmassol> thx  
18:36 <vmassol> bbiab  
18:36 <evalica> :) we can do it also in the context of usability :P but I agree would be a nice feature  
18:36 <evalica> vote for it :P  
18:43 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:00 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> if you want to batch-delete a set of documents from the wiki, can you just delete the rows in the xwikidoc table, or will that break something?
